Title: House of Nightmares B-Movie Edition
Genre: Indie , Early Access
Developer: Morphodox Studios
Publisher: Morphodox Studios
Release Date: Apr 19, 2015

View update history Read related news View discussions Find Community Groups
Share Embed  

Early Access Game

Get instant access and start playing; get involved with this game as it develops.

Note: This Early Access game is not complete and may or may not change further. If you are not excited to play this game in its current state, then you should wait to see if the game progresses further in development. Learn more

What the developers have to say:

Why Early Access?

“Our game, though fully playable, has not had all of the features in the game we wish to have in place to label it as fully complete. It is something we will strive to finish soon, and would love to hear feedback on things to improve and change!”

Approximately how long will this game be in Early Access?

“We plan on the game only being in early access for approximately 3 months, but this may change due to complications with builds and bug fixes.”

How is the full version planned to differ from the Early Access version?

“The finished product will have refined visuals fitting its b-movie style for one story mode, a multiplayer co-op story mode, and a 3rd story mode drifting away from the b-movie style.”

What is the current state of the Early Access version?

“The game as is, has been through multiple spouts and runs of bug testing to bring a fully functioning version of the game. Not all the visuals or ambiance are as they will be. The co-op and second single player story modes are not complete and will not be added into the build until after they are tested and functioning properly.”

Will the game be priced differently during and after Early Access?

“The early access will have a slightly discounted price from the finished product to ensure that anyone who wants to get involved early on can and have their voice heard.”

How are you planning on involving the Community in your development process?

“We have and will continue to listen to the fans as to what they would like to see. Though the game is our vision, we want to share our experiences and love with our fans and let them know they matter.”
Read more

Recent updates View all (7)

October 12

Slightly Longer process than imagined...

We have continued to update everything as much as possible, a few errors have come up. We will put the update out as planned, though it may not be as fullfilled as we had hoped it to be. It will have the Levels and creatures in it, a few of the cutscenes, and a few of the new sounds and voice acting (but not all of them). The menus are almost finished up, though we have been mostly focusing on the newest version of the maps. The update is slated for 2 weeks, and we plan on posting a few things before that update to show a few things. For those who want to play micro versions before the release, simply ask about joining the patch testing. With everything on this update, we are going to cram as much into it as possible, though we cannot garantee all bugs will be worked out or levels being fully completed (filled with objects).


Thank you all - William

0 comments Read more

August 18

New Video and pics to come!

We have been working hard on remaking the monsters to be better, looks and all. We have remade EVERY LAST ONE and even added a few new ones in. We will make a sample video showing the progression of a couple of the known creatures, as well as showing off some changes that have further been made to the maps! We are pushing as hard as we can to get this service out to you, as more is done we see the gleam of the end in sight! It will be a short trip into getting the game from the new version into the finished version from there!

2 comments Read more

Report bugs and leave feedback for this game on the discussion boards

About This Game

What if you woke-up from a nightmare, only to find yourself in another? A nightmare filled with rooms of your worst fears, images of your worst thoughts, long forgotten memories? House of Nightmares does just that! Each floor depicts a different nightmare, a different fear, filled with puzzles and creatures all placed there by the same figure who brought you to this place.

A B-Movie inspired game, based off of the Developers own nightmares and memories, delve into a house filled with monsters, puzzles, scares, and turmoil. Can you handle the house, or will the house handle you?

Several floors- each unique in layout, puzzles, scares, monsters, sounds, paintings, memories, and secrets.

-Over 50 unique paints, no 2 being the same

-simple controls for maximum playability

-A maze-like level design to add puzzles to the puzzles
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows Vista
    • Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo 2.93 GHz
    • Memory: 2 GB RAM
    • Graphics: NVIDIA GT 430
    • DirectX: Version 8.0
    • Hard Drive: 2 GB available space
    Recommended:
    • OS: Windows 7
    • Processor: INTEL CORE-2 QUAD 2.4GHZ 1066MHZ
    • Memory: 4 GB RAM
    • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 550
    • DirectX: Version 10
    • Hard Drive: 5 GB available space
